intro: Penianthus klaineanus, commonly known as the Hawaiian penianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
